fields.description:
Right now, when you click Create Project in JIRA, you are presented with some templates for projects. Two of them are Agile: "Agile Scrum," and "Agile Kanban."

The user needs to make a decision whether they want Scrum or Kanban immediately, without much information to help them make their decision, and they also do not get the opportunity to include sample data.

We should combine "Agile Scrum" and "Agile Kanban" into one entry simply called "Agile" that the user can select, and when they click Next, it should take them to the first step of the new GreenHopper Create Board wizard where they have more information (soon videos) about Scrum vs. Kanban, and also the ability to use sample data.

We will also need to change some wording on the first step of the new Create Board wizard to include a mention about projects, since the user started this flow wanting to create a project, we don't want to confuse them by exclusively talking about boards.
fields.summary: Integrate JIRA's Create Project dialog with the new Create Board wizard

fields.description:
this step may not be possible in the end result but recording anyway in case it's a symptom of something else:

as nonadmin user I click the create link
click scrum
hit escape
click create link
blanker - no dialog
fields.summary: Escaping/cancelling the create board dialog then starting again gives a blanket and  no dialog

fields.description:
Im using the Agile board to manage multiple teams issues and tasks and have setup many quick filters (for versions, users, etc) to allow filtering the content of the board to only what is important at that moment. Unfortunately this requires me to update/change the quick filters at least once a week as old version/users fall off and new ones are added.
The concept for this story is to allow a drop-down list of various items which the board recognizes based upon the board type and projects included:

Agile board dynamic quick filters for: AffectsVersion, FixVersion, User,  and optionally EpicName (includes all issues associated with that epic), StoryName (includes all issues associated with that story - sub issues or linked).
fields.summary: As a Manager I want GH to provide built in "Dynamic Fitlers" so I dont have to contstantly update the Quick Filters for Versions, Users, etc

fields.description: I want to be able to select and epic and print/export to pdf document the hierachy of stories and sub tasks in the order they appear. I need this for non technical managers and clients.
fields.summary: Ability to export an Epic
Create a test for moving issues between future sprints

fields.description:
The following tests should be created:
# User cannot assign issues to a sprint
# User cannot move issues between sprints or remove from a sprint
# User cannot create or start sprint

See PlanModeWithNoPermissionsTest - skeleton tests already in place
fields.summary: Create tests for users with no permission

fields.description: Similar to previous logic but including the Board name too
fields.summary: Sample project Board Name, Project Name and Project Key should be pre-filled

fields.description: On a given screen, if some mandatory fields are not filled in then disable the 'next' or 'create board' button
fields.summary: Disable 'next' or 'create board' button until mandatory steps are complete

fields.description:
Create a sprint, add estimated issues then start the sprint. Now, if you go to the burndown chart report you will see that the issues added before you start the sprint are considered as a scope change.

It breaks the test VelocityChartResourceTest#testVelocityWithIssueAddedInSprint so that the expected estimate should be 5 but is 0.
fields.summary: Adding issue to a sprint before it is started is considered as a scope change
Project Key should convert lowercase text to uppercase (reduce friction)
Closed epics should be automatically marked as "done" in plan mode

fields.description: When we're in the process of sprint planning, the old sprint is still active and in progress, but tickets need to be added to the next sprint. It would be nice for users to be able to assign to the new sprint without having to go to the planning board.
fields.summary: Allow adding to sprints that haven't been opened yet from create form

fields.description: In some cases it could be very helpful if we have the ability to remove (delete) undesired sprints, not only planned sprints.
fields.summary: Allow Deletion of Sprints

fields.description: The list of the epic should be filtered based on the selected quick filter.
fields.summary: The Epic list on the planning mode in the rapid board, should honour the quick filters

fields.description: Not unlike FIx versions (which were available due to them being version pickers)  We would like it if it were possible to have the sprint name available for use in two dimensional filter.
fields.summary: Make Sprint field visible on Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics
GreenHopper marketing plugin should check if the GH plugin is enabled before trying to access classes from it
expand/collapse active sprint test
start parallel active sprint test

fields.description: any difference between active and future?

edit sprint name test

fields.description: openSprints(), futureSprints(), closedSprints()

start sprint test

fields.description:
Acceptance Criteria:
- Similar visual treatment on the Wallboards as with the Agile boards
- Flag icon and yellow tone

Acceptance Criteria:

Due to the change in [GHS-7440] the detail pane does not Archived versions anymore. However they may be relevant and can cause confusion if the user is not aware of this behaviour.

Adding a toggle to show this could help this.
fields.summary: As a user with archived versions I want the option to toggle display of Archived versions

fields.description:
When planning releases ahead of time, but starting development a few weeks after populating the release, I would like to set the intercept of the trend line to the start date of development. 

Otherwise the development speed and projected end date is not properly reflects (e.g. I am always showing a pessimistic release date)
fields.summary: Version Report: Allow Intercept for development start

fields.description:
If I switch between say "work" view and "plan" view and then switch back to "work" no keyboard shortcuts work. I can for example no longer use 'a' for assign without doing a refresh of the browser window.

I run Firefox 21.0 (under linux)
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut breaks in firefox

fields.description: I have two sprints created, sprint 1 and 2. Sprint 1 is active. In planning mode, I cannot move an issue from sprint 1 to 2. I need to first move it from 1 to the backlog and then to 2. It should be possible to just change the sprint version.
fields.summary: Cannot move issue from one sprint to another

fields.description:
Hi
I'm not at all sure this is the right place for this, but I couldn't find where to submit it.

Changing from the old style scrum boards our Project Managers get very frustrated that the new boards are owned and can only be managed by one individual, whereas previously anyone with Project Admin rights could manage them.  Is there any chance this functionality could be provided.  Our projects are usually managed by a few key people rather than just one.
fields.summary: Ownership/Management of Rapid Boards

fields.description: automatically (since Sprint 1 is already activated).  Any reason that story doesn’t get added to the Product Backlog rather than one of the defined sprints?  I would much prefer to added to the Product Backlog grouping first and then users can drag and drop it from there.
fields.summary: - When adding a new story to the Product Backlog, it is adding it to Sprint 2
- Being able to switch Swimlanes without having to go into Board Configuration.

fields.description: I would like to add fields to my GreenHopper cards.
fields.summary: - GreenHopper Card Configuration, add fields
As a GreenHopper User, I would like to be able to use JQL queries for column constraints
As a Rapid Board user, I would like to be able to show only certain subtasks of a story in plan mode

fields.description:
We use the quick filters to show only certain aspects (subtask types) of a story. At the moment the remaining effort is always based on all subtasks and does not consider the quick filter results.

We want the remaining effort of a story being based on the results of the quick filters.

The swim lanes already show the task count based on the quick filters ([^01-QuckFilterBasedRemainingTaskCount.png]). Why not add the remaining effort there ([^02-WhatWeNeed.png])?
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I would like the remaining effort of a story being based on quick filter results

fields.description:
Currently, there are no limits to the Story Points that the user can input. It's even possible for the user to input 1000 as the value of the Story Point. This can cause complications in the estimation and calculations.

Hence, it would be useful to be able to set a certain limit to the amount that a user can enter (for example, they can set the limit to be 100, so that's the highest Story Point they can input).
fields.summary: Ability to set limit of Story Points

fields.description:
When creating new sprint container it is always above the backlog container.
It is impossible to move the new container to other places ( for example to be the first container).

The workaround is to move user stories to the new container and rename it until The relevant container is empty - this is very annoying
fields.summary: New Sprint container is not moveable

fields.description: Need the ability to select all past sprints to view velocity trend over longer times.
fields.summary: Make the number of past sprints displayed in the Velocity Chart configurable

fields.description:
Today we cannot use sprint field for filtering.
It might be very useful to filter issues related to specific sprints from the past or to see all sprints.
fields.summary: Add ability to filter issues that are/were related to sprint

fields.description:
When we have an issue in the Done status (Closed) with any sub-tasks in the Open status, this issue doesn`t appear in the backlog, on the Plan Mode.

It would be great if we can have an option in GreenHopper to show those issues in the backlog, so we can plan a Sprint with the sub-tasks.

This will also need to allow an user to close a Sprint with issues in the Done status but with opened sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Ability to view Done issues with open sub-tasks in the backlog

fields.description:
As as a Project Manager, I find it very difficult/impossible to use the Agile boards to see ALL work on a particular team members plate for the current sprint. This is essential for managing a project. 

The issues is that it is either not possible, not easy, or not documented, how to view owner level summaries in the boards.   There is an option to "View in Issue Navigator" but this leaves out subtasks which means again, there is no way to see ALL work for a particular team member for the current sprint.

This is partially related to the fact that subtasks are treated as second class citizens and don't appear in the Plan, or Report board and other areas. (Please, please, change that!)
fields.summary: Display summary of all issues/sorypoints (including subtasks) by owner for a sprint

fields.description:
Hi,
My name is Michal and I am leading the Agile process in Liveperson. We are using Jira and Greenhopper successfully few years now.

I have an enhancement request:
I would like to be able to choose if I want to see # of issues or total T-shirt/points in the reports.
For example - the CFD is only about # of issues but the velocity chart is only about T-shirt/points.
I would like to be able to choose the appropriate view in each report.
In other reports like the sprint report, I get sum of t-shirt/points but not sum of stories.
fields.summary: Reporting Enhancement

fields.description:
I choose the Epic Report, which defaulted to a certain epic in the project.  I click on the Epic dropdown to choose a single epic.  A list is shown that fills the screen from top to bottom, without the ability to scroll the list.

I can pick one of the epics showing, which are not in ranked order, and the report will show just that epic.

I have no way to pick any of the epics that are off the screen at the top or the bottom.  And the report continues to default to whatever epic I picked last, so I am stuck only being able to report on a handful of the epics that exist in the project.

Please allow the list to be scrollable so I can pick any epic.
fields.summary: Long epic list in Epic Report unscrollable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9167].
  {panel}


{panel:title=Atlassian status as of February 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this issue. We understand this has been a long long long running request. We also understand this has caused a lot of frustration so I don't want to ignore that fact, but I do want to strike a chord of optimism with this update. 

As John mentions in the comment below - the automation team have been busily building out an amazing library of automation rules which cover a massive range of use cases.
Summing estimates from subtasks to stories is one of these rules and here is the link to how to create this rule...
https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/automation-template-library/sum-up-story-points 
Please note there is no limit to the number of rules that you can execute within a single project.

We do have plans to bring more of these rules from the public library into the in-product automations library, but for now you must replicate the rules manually.

We're really interested to get your feedback on the success / gaps of this solution so please let us, as well as all other interested users, know here.

Thank you,
Eoin
Product Manager
{panel}
h3. Summary

As a Greenhopper Scrum product owner, I want story estimates to automatically total to the sum of the estimates for all sub-tasks IF and ONLY IF subtasks are entered (else I want story estimates to be manual entry) so that I can view on the scrum board the original estimate against the remaining time.

Definition of Done:
1)  When no sub-tasks exist for a story, the estimate field for the story allows entry of a value manually
2)  When one or more sub-tasks exist for a story, the estimate field for the story is calculated as the sum of the estimates for all sub-tasks for that story

Context:

I'm finding a feature in Greenhopper to NOT operate as I would have expected. The feature is in estimating where the estimation on the scrum board is configured for original time estimates. What I would like is: 
1) when no sub-tasks are created for a story, the estimation and remaining fields are editable within the story 
2) when sub-tasks have been created, the story estimate and remaining fields are calculated as the sum of the estimate and remaining fields for the sub-tasks 

What's currently happening is that the story estimate field is not calculated from the sum of the sub-tasks but the story remaining field is. Worse, if you enter a value in the story estimate field when sub-tasks have been added and estimated, the value entered into the story estimate field is added to the story remaining field, which already has the sum of the sub-tasks. Thus, if, as a work around, you try to manually enter a story estimate that equals the sum of the sub-task estimates, the story remaining field value doubles. There's no work around for this. This feature seems poorly defined. I understand what the product team was trying to accomplish... the ability to estimate and view remaining values for stories that have no sub-tasks or prior to sub-tasks being added. What they missed is that the field could serve both functions - manual entry when no sub-tasks exist and calculated value when sub-tasks do exist. I strongly urge the product team to consider this feature at their earliest opportunity as the inability to see from the scrum board the original estimate against the remaining value in plan and work mode is a problem. 

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Configure Scrum board to use "Original Time Estimate" for Estimation Statistic
# Configure Scrum board to use "Remaining Estimate and Time Spent" for Time Tracking
# Create an issue with issue type Story, without specifying any Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate
# Create 2 sub-tasks for this issue.
#* Sub-task 1 has Remaining Estimate of 4 hours
#* Sub-task 2 has Remaining Estimate of 2 hours
# Checking parent of sub-tasks in Issue View, Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate is now shown as 6 hours
# Navigate back to Scrum board, open Issue Detail View, and Original Estimate for parent issue is _Unestimated_
fields.summary: Sum estimates from sub-tasks in user stories
Ensure that automated tests around future sprints/plan mode are functioning

fields.description: Date format is mm/dd/yy when system settings are set to dd/MMM/yyyy
fields.summary: Release Date on Version Report is Wrong Format

fields.description: It would be useful to be able to edit the name of closed sprints, currently it is only possible to edit the name of active sprints.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to edit the name of a closed Sprint

fields.description:
As per [this issue|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5903] I see that we earlier mentioned that users can use drag/drop to move issues out of an active sprint.
bq. Click Plan, then drag the issue out of the planned sprint and into another sprint or into the backlog.


However, this was not working so we fixed it in the documentation. 
As a user this would be the most intuitive way to do it. Currently there are no hints as to why a user is not able to drag drop an issue out of the sprint in the Plan mode. We should fix that.

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Add drag drop functionality to Remove an issue from active sprint

fields.description:
Here are the steps to reproduce the issue from scratch: 
# Install a fresh JIRA instance and install the Greenhopper plugin. 
# Create two new Epic tickets (TESTFIRST-1 with Epic label 01 and TESTFIRST-2 with Epic label 02) with the "create issue" (link or button) on the JIRA dashboard.
# Lock JIRA and reindex.
# Try to create new issue with the "create issue" (link or button) on the JIRA dashboard, and open the Epic link drop down menu. It appeared that the Epic label is mismatch with the Epic ticket
!Screen Shot 2013-08-05 at 1.20.51 PM.png!

*PS: the issue is not reproduced if the first Epic is created via the scrum board of JIRA.*

Workaround:
# If you start typing a string, the suggested list will be corrected
# Use GreenHopper's planning board to assign Epics
fields.summary: Incorrect suggestion on the Epic link field on the issue creation screen

fields.description: See screenshot
fields.summary: Layout of Issue Links in Detail View is broken

fields.description:
Currently, in GreenHopper board, if there is a child issue for a parent Epic issue, and this child issue is cloned to another issue,  The latter one does not have any link to the parent Epic issue.

It will be nice if it's possible to have a link between the cloned issue and the parent Epic issue.
fields.summary: Link issues cloned to child issues of an Epic issue type to the parent Epic.
Add better tooltips to GH - AUI component (based on tipsy)

fields.description: As a scrum master I want to see tickets grouped by epic on my kanban boards.
fields.summary: Implement Epic-based swim lanes for Kanban boards

fields.description: Since the latest release, the font for issues changed and now on our larger boards, we cannot readily view the Issue numbers without hovering over the cards.  We have a workaround which involves zooming out to 75%, but that makes all the tickets extremely small.  My users are very annoyed by this.  Thank you.
fields.summary: Can't see Issue number on large boards

fields.description:
I am using Jira + Atlassian plugin in the past 2 years and I am very happy with the production.

I have a feature suggestion:
add counter to each user story (in work screen) that count down the days from the moment user story is in progress. for example user story with 4 user story point will show the number 4 when it start to be in progress in the next day 3 and so own.

I think it will give a view to the team how much they spend on the user story against their estimation
fields.summary: Add Count down to user story

fields.description:
The [GreenHopper 6.2 documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+Estimation+and+Tracking] says:

 {quote} A common approach is to estimate tasks in Story Points, then track tasks using hours. {quote} 

Since one estimates in story points it is also common to see the story points burndown and also track the remaining time. 

To see both the story points burndown and also the remaining time one has to toggle the tracking statistic between none and Remaining Estimate and Time Spent. 

Prior to GH 6 one could have a burndown chart of the story points left and also the time left. Please can this functionality be re-added.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to change estimation statistics for the Sprint burndown independently from the board configuration

fields.description:
Currently, if customer has a pre-defined fixed version (example: version test) and on the GreenHopper Kanban board. If the customer would want to release the issue associated with this pre-defined fixed version, it returns error as the screenshot below:

!release.png!

Kanban board default filter:
{noformat}
fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion is EMPTY
{noformat}

It should enable the customer to release for unreleased version as well.

Quote from customer:
{quote}Therefor issues with an unreleased fix version (because this field is used for planning purpose) will appear on the board but cannot be released!{quote}

*Steps to Replicate*
# Create a Kanban Board associated with Project
# Create a version on the project, no release date defined
# Perform edit on the issues to plan fixing the issue on the newly created version
# Move all the issues planned to the done column
# Release and insert the version as planned earlier
# Noticed error message
fields.summary: Kanban Release for a Planned Fixed Version

fields.description:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-7753 implemented support for swimlane by epic for Scrum boards only - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+6.2.1+Release+Notes#GreenHopper6.2.1ReleaseNotes-Epic-basedSwimlanes

I have the same use case for a team that uses the Kanban boards.
fields.summary: Swimlane by epic for Kanban boards

fields.description: It would be a great feature to be able to search on the issue navigator for issues that were added to the sprint after the start of this given sprint.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to search for issues that were added after the start of the Sprint in the issue navigator

fields.description:
Q: what happens when Plan mode shortcut used on a Kanban board?
A: Goes to Work mode

Q: What happens when header is hidden(z)?
A: Works as normal
fields.summary: As a user I would like to change between Plan | Work | Report modes using keyboard shortcuts
Update close icon in Detail View to be a font icon
Create board is activated when only one item in menu even if disabled

fields.description: Exists in icon font, use "Search small" https://developer.atlassian.com/design/iconography.html
fields.summary: Update search icon in quick search box to be a font icon
As a user I want to open Plan | Work | Report modes in a new tab
Hovering over a colour in an issue on work mode should tell you what that colour is mapped to
Review the position and behaviour of the Feedback tab
In the Give Feedback modal, we ask users to "Rate this page" when really we want their feedback on the whole product

fields.description: GreenHopper Classis Agile Gadget is horizontally cut off
fields.summary: GreenHopper Classic Agile Gadget is horizontally cut off

fields.description:
It would be good if a RapidBoard owner could mark a Version as Done so that it doesn't show up anymore. Or, you could trigger hiding the version based on its release status. There is no value on a planning board to show old versions.

Basically, I'm asking for the same ability you have to mark an epic as done for versions.
fields.summary: Mark a version as Done in the Plan Board

fields.description:
As a project administrator and agile board owner, I want to force developers to choose a specific resolution value from a defined set upon entering a specified ticket status so that we don't forget to set the proper resolution so we may query tickets for duplicates, fixes, won't fixes, etc.

The team is using the GreenHopper simplified workflow for Jira ticket status.  It would be nice if between status changes from "In Progress" to "Ready" a pop-up appeared that allowed the developer to modify the Resolution from "Incomplete" or "Unresolved" to "Fixed", "Won't Fix", "Duplicate", etc.  Right now, the workaround is to create a subscription to a filter that warns us when tickets are in the "Ready" or "Done" status, but have "Unresolved" or "Incomplete" as their resolution field value.
fields.summary: As a project administrator, I want to force developers to choose a specific resolution value from a defined set upon entering a specified status

fields.description:
The term "epic" is translated to "Epos" which is quite correct, but mostly used in literature (like "Das Beowulf-Epos/The epic of Beowulf").

Technical- and Scrum users refer to "Epic" or "Epics" even in German. "Epos" looks very strange and should be changed accordingly in the property-files.
fields.summary: i18n (German): The term "epic" is mistranslated.

fields.description:
We are a small publishing company and new to JIRA. We aim to use it for running a small in-house web development team, and also some company processes like IT.

We want to use agile boards to plan an execute work.
We have many and varied requirements and have found the best way for us is to put them in as stories describing the need/benefit of meeting; then attaching subtasks with detailed time estimates.
This works well until we get to reporting. *When we look at Agile reports, all the lines are flat.* 

We are using time estimation, not story points. 

*_What do we need to do to set ourselves correctly?_*
 
Attachments
# Grab - screenshot of a typical story with sub tasks
# Grab1.jpg The issues in agile view. Our sub task time estimates show up. But there is no figure at story level
# Grab2.jpg - our burnt-out burn down chart!
fields.summary: How do we configure estimation and time tracking

fields.description:
# Have an active sprint which existed before this version (i.e. do not create a new one)
# Empty the sprint by selecting all issues and dragging them into backlog
# Go to Report Mode and choose Burndown Chart
fields.summary: A sprint which was emptied cannot be queried in Report mode and generates error message
Delete OD-specific project creation code.

fields.description:
We attempted to run the rank index checker from https://bitbucket.org/jhatherly/greenhopper-rankindex-checker on a 70mb activeobjects.xml and it took over 4 hours to run. This was for a Level 1 issue and it resulted in the customer experiencing some significant downtime from GreenHopper which was not cool for them. :(

Can you please give the rank index checker some love so that it more effecient? Thanks! :)
fields.summary: Please improve the Rank Index Checker so it is optimised for larger files
First view should have DV at default size (400px) - appears ~ 50%

fields.description: As a JIRA Administrator, I'd like to be able to send notifications to all Board Owners. This would be especially helpful to notify Board Owners of any changes in GreenHopper configurations or changes implemented in newer versions.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator I'd like to be able to send notifications to all Board Owners

fields.description: At the moment, there is no way to configure the Greenhopper sprint report. It would be great, if we have the ability to include custom field in the sprint report .
fields.summary: As a scrum master, it would be great to include custom field in the sprint report

fields.description:
As a user
I want to be able to abandon epics rather than marking them as done
so I can better differentiate work that was actually done, rather than just ideas.


Currently I have the ability to mark an epic as "Won't Fix" through the JIRA ticket status, but there is no GH equivalent. I think it's important to be able to differentiate between stuff that was *really* done, and stuff that was abandoned as a nice idea.
fields.summary: Add support for "abandoning" epics
User without the schedule permission gets the wrong error message when trying to rank.

- T shortcut won't bring up detailsview, after expanding epic or version panel, the shortcut does work again.

Cannot select issues in multiple sprints now

There were 4 issues in the second sprint, thus the 4 js errors. The end state left the backlog marker frozen at a position on the screen, see attached.

fields.description: Tickets get created all the time that belong to epics. It's inconvenient to always have to go to planning mode to assign them. Better would be to have an auto-complete epic field as part of the issue editing screen.

fields.description: Customers would like the ability to separate subtasks from parents when viewing them in work mode on a rapidboard. This is in order to track/assign work to different users via subtasks while still under a single parent task.
fields.summary: Add the ability to separate subtasks from parents

fields.description:
When selecting Sprint report and clicking on the sprint to select our sprint, if there is too much sprint to list, the top list is unreachable. It would need a scroll or something like that.

It has been tested on Chrome, IE and Firefox 
We are usign Jira 6.0, GreenHopper 6.2.2, Agile Report Plugin 1.0
fields.summary: Unable to reach a sprint version in Sprint report

fields.description: As of now, when the Issue Detail pane is displayed, there are three cog icons in the top right corner of the screen. They all serve completely different purposes, but look pretty much the same. In some cases, users end up deleting a whole Board instead of an Issue, because the two cogs are so easy to mistake. It would help if they looked at least slightly different.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like a clearer distinction between all the cogs in and around the Issue Detail pane
Show confirmation message when adding an issue to an active sprint

fields.description: As a scrum master, I'd like to be able to mark issues that have been added after the sprint starts as part of the original scope. Very often, there are a few straggler tickets that come in shortly after I've clicked "Start Sprint". Ideally there would be a way to have those not be marked as scope change. They really aren't and having them marked as such reduces the value of both the burn down chart and that marking in other places.
fields.summary: Add issues to current sprint as part of original scope
Fix up tests
ChartBoardAction.doSetCurveColor Persistent XSS
ConfigurationAction.doSetCardColor Persistent XSS
